title: Understanding the Purpose
text: Consider what the main goal of a literature review is. Is it just to list sources, or is there a deeper purpose?

title: Focus on Analysis
text: Think about whether a literature review involves analyzing the sources or simply summarizing them.

title: Narrative vs. Notes
text: Reflect on whether a literature review is more narrative in nature or if it resembles a collection of notes.

hintAnswer: A literature review provides a thorough dive into the field from a narrative perspective, not just notes
title: Identify the Key Difference
text: What is the key difference between a literature review and an annotated bibliography?
choices: A literature review is a straightforward recitation of what you read, like a book report
There is no difference; a literature review is the research term for annotated bibliography
A literature review must include all of the literature you have read on the topic
A literature review provides a thorough dive into the field from a narrative perspective, not just notes
